snippet: The editor fueled a scandal when he charged that Greece was governed by a small group of business elites who were above paying taxes while the rest of the population suffered deep cuts.
abstract: Kostas Vaxevanis, owner and editor of Greek investigative magazine Hot Doc, is acquitted of charges of breaching privacy laws in publishing the names of more than 2,000 Greeks believed to be evading taxes by holding Swiss bank accounts.
lead_paragraph: The editor fueled a scandal when he charged that Greece was governed by a small group of business elites who were above paying taxes while the rest of the population suffered deep cuts.

headline.seo: Greek Editor Not Guilty in Publishing Names With  Swiss Accounts
headline.main: Greek Editor Not Guilty in Publishing Names With Swiss Accounts
headline.print_headline: Greek Editor Acquitted In Listing Swiss Accounts
